body:
So, it's been what, a year and nine months after I first joined this community?

Well, I've been lacking on being able to fulfill my duties as a staff member. Life is just being a pain in general, so I just want to take the time to inform you all that I'll be resigning from my position as a staff member. Avicus has been a wonderful experience, a second family to me if you will. It has truly given me memories that I'll forever cherish. Thank you to everyone. The entire staff team, and the community. I wish you guys all the best.

Goodbye, I'll miss you guys.

replies.body:
Mountie,
You were one of my first real friends on Avicus. We've talked almost daily, and you were one of my inspirations to apply for staff, and I'll never thank you   enough. 
You're a hero, a role model, and a real friend.
Thank you, and I really hope we stay in touch.

replies.body:
Negative you say? towards the thread?

You can't possibly expect me to say my farewells to him, that is for my own accord. 
Think about other leaving posts, or posts of inactivity.
Those normally get deemed as attention seeking, or locked for "inactivity posts are not allowed", so why wouldn't those same factors be attributed to this given the same circumstances? There is no room for exceptions, that would be bias.

You can't always expect positive reinforcement from other people on a thread.
